content: stitches or if you re at a fiber festival/knit group and don t have the attention span for performing heel flap magic for this version take that leg you just finished and keep knitting knit for a total of 13 13 8 14 6 inches if you ve knit a 6 inch leg tip you can go ahead and knit the toe now or you can leave these stitches on the needle knit your heel try on the sock for fit then adjust your foot length if needed then work your toe the choice is yours my friend pick up 28 32 36 with needle 1 skip one row of stitches and pick up 28 32 36 stitches again as shown in this tutorial https //www youtube com/watch v=616gmtaywlu if you want to use use waste yarn there are lots of great video tutorials on that too afterthought heel decreases worked over 56 64 72 stitches row 1 k1 ssk knit to 3 stitches before next marker k2tog k1 sm repeat once to end row 2 knit all stitches repeat row 1 & 2 until you have 8 10 12 stitches on the needle kitchener stitch heel together with tapestry needle foot if you worked a heel flap knit all stitches every round until foot measures 7 7 8 8 6 inches from the heel flap or until the foot measures the length of your foot minus 2 2 2 2 4 inches toe row 1 k1 ssk knit to 3 stitches before next marker k2tog k1 sm repeat once to end 4 stitches decreased row 2 knit all stitches repeat row 1 & 2 until you have 16 20 24 stitches on needle separate stitches evenly between two needles so that the top of the foot stitches are on one needle and the bottom stitches on a second kitchener stitch toe together with tapestry needle stitch dictionary k - knit ssk - slip first stitch as to knit slip second as to knit knit two stitches together k2tog - knit 2 stitches together as one stitch p2tog - purl 2 stitches together as one stitch pm - place stitch marker sm - slip marker rs - right side ws - wrong side
